triples.name: Software verification
triples.relevance: The paper presents a competition on software verification tools, building on established verification research and methodologies.

triples.name: Formal verification
triples.relevance: Formal verification is the theoretical foundation for the verification tools being compared in the competition.

triples.name: C (programming language)
triples.relevance: The benchmark set includes 30,300 verification tasks for C programs that are evaluated in the competition.

triples.name: Java (programming language)
triples.relevance: The benchmark set includes 587 verification tasks for Java programs that are evaluated in the competition.

triples.name: Memory safety
triples.relevance: Memory safety is one of the key specifications (along with reachability, overflows, and termination) used to evaluate verification tools.

triples.name: Integer overflow
triples.relevance: Overflow detection is one of the verification tasks included in the competition benchmark specifications.

triples.name: Termination analysis
triples.relevance: Termination is one of the four key specifications (reachability, memory safety, overflows, termination) used to evaluate verification tools.

triples.name: Reachability analysis
triples.relevance: Reachability is one of the four main verification specifications in the SV-COMP benchmark.

triples.name: Benchmark (computing)
triples.relevance: The paper introduces a new benchmark set with 30,300 C and 587 Java verification tasks for comparing verification tools.

triples.name: Witness (mathematics)
triples.relevance: The paper introduces a new witness format 2.0 and establishes a witness validation competition track with new scoring schema.
